parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description:
XX.--DECOD 
This would be copied from the SDTM domain XX. It is typically one of the primary variables used in an analysis and would be brought in from the SDTM domain. Equivalent to the Preferred Term (PT in MedDRA). As mentioned above, all other SDTM domain variables and supplemental qualifiers needed for analysis or traceability should also be included. Include the dictionary version in the metadata. 
Conditional on whether coded and used for analysis. Required for Adverse Event data.
analysisVariables.label: Dictionary-Derived Term
analysisVariables.name: --DECOD

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description:
XX.--BODSYS 
This would be copied from the SDTM domain XX. It is typically one of the primary variables used in an analysis and would be brought in from the SDTM domain. As mentioned above, all other SDTM domain variables and supplemental qualifiers needed for analysis or traceability should also be included. Include the dictionary version in the metadata. 
Conditional on whether coded and used for analysis. Required for Adverse Event data.
analysisVariables.label: Body System or Organ Class
analysisVariables.name: --BODSYS

Examples include records of special interest like prohibited medications, concomitant medications taken during an infusion reaction, growth factors, antimicrobial medications, and other such categories not defined elsewhere or present in SDTM domains.

analysisVariables.name: ACATy

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description:
Created from converting XX.--STDTC from character ISO8601 format to numeric date format, applying imputation rules as specified in the SAP or metadata.
Conditional on whether start date is pertinent for study and is populated in SDTM.
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Start Date
analysisVariables.name: ASTDT

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description:
Example derivation:
ASTDT - ADSL.TRTSDT + 1 if ASTDT >= TRTSDT, else ASTDT - ADSL.TRTSDT if ASTDT< TRTSDT
This variable may instead be copied from --STDY.
Conditional on whether analysis start relative day is pertinent to the study.
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Start Relative Day
analysisVariables.name: ASTDY

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

self.title: Study Day of Start of Observation

analysisVariables.description:
XX.--STDY
This would be copied from the SDTM domain XX.
ASTDY may differ from --STDY due to date imputation and the option in ADaM to use a reference date other than SDTM's RFSTDTC. Including XX.--STDY in addition to ASTDY adds traceability.
analysisVariables.label: Study Day of Start of Observation
analysisVariables.name: --STDY

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description:
Example derivation:
AENDT - ADSL.TRTSDT + 1 if AENDT >= TRTSDT, else AENDT - ADSL.TRTSDT if AENDT < TRTSDT
This variable may instead be copied from --ENDY.
analysisVariables.label: Analysis End Relative Day
analysisVariables.name: AENDY

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

self.title: Study Day of End of Observation

analysisVariables.description:
XX.--ENDY
This would be copied from the SDTM domain XX.
AENDY may differ from --ENDY due to date imputation and the option in ADaM to use a reference date other than SDTM's RFSTDTC. Including XX.--ENDY in addition to AENDY adds traceability.
analysisVariables.label: Study Day of End of Observation
analysisVariables.name: --ENDY

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: Derive from ASTDT (or ASTDTM) and AENDT (or AENDTM).
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Duration (N)
analysisVariables.name: ADURN

codelist.title: Version-agnostic anchor resource for codelist C71620

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: Conditional on whether ADURN is included and units are not included in the label of ADURN.
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Duration Units
analysisVariables.name: ADURU

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description:
XX.--DUR
This would be copied from the SDTM domain XX.
Because --DUR is a collected field and ADURN is derived, the values will often differ. Including XX.--DUR in addition to ADURN adds traceability.
analysisVariables.label: Duration of XX
analysisVariables.name: --DUR

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: APERIOD is a record-level timing variable that represents the analysis period within the study associated with the record for analysis purposes. The value of APERIOD (if populated) must be one of the xx values found in the ADSL TRTxxP variables. See the ADaM Implementation Guide version 1.1[2]for more information on this variable.
analysisVariables.label: Period
analysisVariables.name: APERIOD

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: Text characterizing to which period the record belongs. One-to-one map to APERIOD.
analysisVariables.label: Period (C)
analysisVariables.name: APERIODC

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: APHASE is a categorization of timing within a study, for example a higher-level categorization of APERIOD or an analysis epoch. For example, APHASE could describe spans of time for SCREENING, ON TREATMENT, and FOLLOW-UP. See the ADaM Implementation Guide version 1.1[2]for more information on this variable.
analysisVariables.label: Phase
analysisVariables.name: APHASE

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0
ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.label: XX Occurrence
analysisVariables.name: --OCCUR

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0
ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description:
The ANLzzFL flag is useful in many circumstances; an example is when there is more than one coding path included for analysis, in which case separate analysis flags could be used to denote primary coding path or the records used for analysis from each coding path.
See the ADaM Implementation Guide version 1.1[2] for more information on this flag variable.
This variable is conditional on whether analysis records flags are needed for analysis.
analysisVariables.label: Analysis Flag zz
analysisVariables.name: ANLzzFL

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0
ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description:
Treatment emergent flag as defined for analysis. Variable TRTEMFL is to be used for any analysis of treatment-emergent AEs. This variable is conditional on whether the concept of treatment emergent is a key feature of the AE analyses.
Example derivation:
If ADSL.TRTSDT<=ASTDT<=ADSL.TRTEDT + x days then TRTEMFL='Y'
The number x is defined by the producer and often incorporates the known half-life of the drug. It should be consistent with variable APHASE (described above) if APHASE is also used.
analysisVariables.label: Treatment Emergent Analysis Flag
analysisVariables.name: TRTEMFL

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description:
Treatment emergent flag from SDTM, if available. See the SDTMIG version 3.2[3]for more information.
Derivation:
SUPPAE.QVAL where QNAM='AETRTEM'.
TRTEMFL may differ from AETRTEM due to different definitions, date imputation and other analysis rules. Including AETRTEM in addition to TRTEMFL will add traceability.
analysisVariables.label: Treatment Emergent Flag
analysisVariables.name: AETRTEM

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0
ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description:
Character indicator of whether the observation occurred while the subject was on treatment.
Example derivation:
If ADSL.TRTSDT <= ASTDT <= ADSL.TRTEDT then ONTRTFL = 'Y'
This variable is conditional on whether the concept of on-treatment is a feature of the study and used in analysis.
analysisVariables.label:
On Treatment
Record Flag
analysisVariables.name: ONTRTFL

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

self.title: Adverse Events and Concomitant Medications Indicator Variables

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

parentVariableSet.title: Adverse Events and Concomitant Medications Indicator Variables

analysisVariables.description:
Character indicator of whether the observation occurred before the subject started treatment.
Example derivation:
If ASTDT < ADSL.TRTSDT then PREFL='Y'
This variable is conditional on whether the concept of pre-treatment is a feature of the study and used in analysis.
analysisVariables.label: Pre-treatment Flag
analysisVariables.name: PREFL

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

parentVariableSet.title: Adverse Events and Concomitant Medications Indicator Variables

analysisVariables.description:
Character indicator of whether the observation occurred while the subject was on follow-up.
Example derivation:
If ASTDT > ADSL.TRTEDT then FUPFL='Y'
This variable is conditional on whether the concept of follow-up is a feature of the study and used in analysis.
analysisVariables.label: Follow-up Flag
analysisVariables.name: FUPFL

analysisVariableSets.label: Adverse Events and Concomitant Medications Indicator Variables
analysisVariableSets.name: Adverse Events and Concomitant Medications Indicator Variables

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0
ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description:
Character indicator for the first occurrence of any event/intervention/finding within the subject.
Example derivation: Sort the data in the required order and flag the first treatment emergent record for each subject.
analysisVariables.label: 1st Occurrence within Subject Flag
analysisVariables.name: AOCCFL

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description:
Character indicator for the first occurrence of the preferred term within the subject.
Example derivation: Sort the data in the required order and flag the first treatment emergent record for each --DECOD for each subject.
analysisVariables.label: 1st Occurrence of Preferred Term Flag
analysisVariables.name: AOCCPFL

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description:
Character indicator for the first occurrence of the event/intervention/finding with the maximum severity/intensity within the subject.
Example derivation: Sort the data in the required order and flag the first treatment emergent record for maximum severity for each subject.
analysisVariables.label: 1st Max Sev./Int. Occurrence Flag
analysisVariables.name: AOCCIFL

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

priorVersion.title: 1st Max Sev./Int. Occur Within PT Flag

self.title: 1st Max Sev./Int. Occur Within PT Flag

analysisVariables.description:
Character indicator for the first occurrence of the maximum severity/intensity within the subject and preferred term.
Example derivation: Sort the data in the required order and flag the first treatment emergent record for maximum severity within preferred term for each subject.
analysisVariables.label: 1st Max Sev./Int. Occur Within PT Flag
analysisVariables.name: AOCCPIFL

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: Additional flag variables as needed for analysis. Derivation rules for these flags need to be described in the metadata.
analysisVariables.label: 1st Occurrence of ...
analysisVariables.name: AOCCzzFL

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0
ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description:
Character indicator for the first occurrence of the system organ class within the subject.
Example derivation: Sort the data in the required order and flag the first treatment emergent record for each body system for each subject.
analysisVariables.label: 1st Occurrence of SOC Flag
analysisVariables.name: AOCCSFL

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

priorVersion.title: 1st Max Sev./Int. Occur Within SOC Flag

self.title: 1st Max Sev./Int. Occur Within SOC Flag

analysisVariables.description:
Character indicator for the first occurrence of the maximum severity/intensity within the subject and system organ class.
Example derivation: Sort the data in the required order and flag the first treatment emergent record for maximum severity within body system for each subject.
analysisVariables.label: 1st Max Sev./Int. Occur Within SOC Flag
analysisVariables.name: AOCCSIFL

priorVersion.title: Study Drug Dose at AE Onset

analysisVariables.description:
Dose received at the point in time of the record start date.
Example derivation:
Obtained from EX.EXDOSE where --STDTC falls between the values of EX.EXSTDTC and
EX.EXENDTC
analysisVariables.label:
Treatment Dose at
Record Start
analysisVariables.name: DOSEON

Treatment Dose

analysisVariables.description:
The standardized MedDRA queries name. Would be blank for terms that are not in the SMQ. Therefore this variable could be blank for all records if no terms within the study were included in the SMQ.
Conditional on whether SMQ analysis is done.
analysisVariables.label: SMQ zz Name
analysisVariables.name: SMQzzNAM

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: The standardized MedDRA queries number code.
analysisVariables.label: SMQ zz Code
analysisVariables.name: SMQzzCD

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description:
The search strategy for SMQs can be narrow or broad. The preferred terms that are narrow in scope have high specificity for identifying events of interest while the broad terms have high sensitivity. By definition, all narrow terms are also considered within the broad scope. Therefore, to summarize all broad terms, terms with either narrow OR broad would be considered.Will be null for terms that do not meet the criteria.
Conditional on whether SMQ analysis is done.
analysisVariables.label: SMQ zz Scope
analysisVariables.name: SMQzzSC

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description: Will be null for terms that do not meet the criteria.
analysisVariables.label: SMQ zz Scope (N)
analysisVariables.name: SMQzzSCN

parentProduct.title: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0

analysisVariables.description:
The customized query (CQ) name or name of the AE of special interest category based on a grouping of terms. Would be blank for terms that are not in the CQ.
Conditional on whether CQ analysis is done.
Examples: "DERMATOLOGICAL EVENTS" "CARDIAC EVENTS", "IARS (INFUSION ASSOCIATED REACTIONS)"
analysisVariables.label: Customized Query zz Name
analysisVariables.name: CQzzNAM

dataStructures.description: One record per record in SDTM domain (optional: per coding path, per Analysis Period and/or Phase)
dataStructures.label: Occurrence Data Structure
dataStructures.name: OCCDS

description:
The statistical analysis data structure presented in this document describes the general data structure and content typically found in occurrence analysis. Occurrence analysis is the counting of subjects with a given record or term, and often includes a structured hierarchy of dictionary coding categories. Examples of data that fit into this structure include those used for typical analysis of Adverse Events, Concomitant Medications, and Medical History. The structure is based on the ADaM Analysis Data Model V2.1 [1] and the ADaM Analysis Data Model Implementation Guide (ADaMIG) V1.1 [2].

This document is based on the document titled "Analysis Data Model (ADaM) Data Structure for Adverse Event Analysis" released by the CDISC ADaM team on May 10, 2012. It replaces this earlier document, making it more generic and applicable to analysis of more than just adverse event data.
label: ADaM Structure for Occurrence Data (OCCDS) Version 1.0
name: ADaM OCCDS v1.0
source: Prepared by the CDISC Analysis Data Model Team
